text: Hi all - how easy is it to rename a deployed Mainnet validator to another entity? is there a playbook for this?

elements.text: Hi all - how easy is it to rename a deployed Mainnet validator to another entity? is there a playbook for this?

text: If you are talking about validator hint it can't be renamed

elements.text: If you are talking about validator hint it can't be renamed

Hi team we are in the process of deploying our validator on testnet (0.4.4 - k8s) and we stumbled across this error when deploying the validator (participant & postgres went fine), can you please help us out?
Error logs are attached as a txt file below:
```validator_backend app initialization: Initialization failed, so exiting; check the application logs for details

	at com.daml.metrics.InstrumentedExecutorServiceMetrics$InstrumentedExecutorService$InstrumentedRunnable.run(InstrumentedExecutorServiceMetrics.scala:190)

	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinPool.scan(ForkJoinPool.java:1843)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinPool.runWorker(ForkJoinPool.java:1808)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinWorkerThread.run(ForkJoinWorkerThread.java:188)
Caused by: org.apache.pekko.http.scaladsl.unmarshalling.Unmarshaller$UnsupportedContentTypeException: Unsupported Content-Type [Some(text/html)], supported: application/json
	at org.apache.pekko.http.scaladsl.unmarshalling.Unmarshaller$UnsupportedContentTypeException$.apply(Unmarshaller.scala:214)
	at org.apache.pekko.http.scaladsl.unmarshalling.Unmarshaller$EnhancedFromEntityUnmarshaller$.$anonfun$forContentTypes$3(Unmarshaller.scala:129)
	at org.apache.pekko.http.scaladsl.unmarshalling.Unmarshaller$$anon$1.apply(Unmarshaller.scala:72)
	at org.apache.pekko.http.scaladsl.unmarshalling.Unmarshaller$EnhancedUnmarshaller$.$anonfun$flatMapWithInput$3(Unmarshaller.scala:110)

	at org.apache.pekko.http.scaladsl.unmarshalling.Unmarshaller.$anonfun$transform$3(Unmarshaller.scala:37)

text:
We are having trouble deploying 0.4.3 on MainNet using docker-compose method. When we first deployed it, all containers were healthy but had issues with Auth0 and redirects. Made some changes to our .env file, destroyed the containers and volumes, and redeployed (like we did in DevNet) and now the validator container shows unhealthy -> "container splice-validator-validator-1 is unhealthy" and goes into "starting" loop:
ed8d549f967a   <http://ghcr.io/digital-asset/decentralized-canton-sync/docker/validator-app:0.4.3|ghcr.io/digital-asset/decentralized-canton-sync/docker/validator-app:0.4.3>        "/usr/bin/tini -- /a…"   18 minutes ago   Up 42 seconds (health: starting)   5003/tcp, 10013/tcp                   splice-validator-validator-1

From the container logs, I see the following errors:
Caused by: org.lfdecentralizedtrust.splice.admin.api.client.commands.HttpCommandException: HTTP 401 Unauthorized POST at '/api/sv/v0/onboard/validator' on <http://sv.sv-2.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com|sv.sv-2.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com>. Command failed, message: Secret has already been used for a different validator.
        at org.lfdecentralizedtrust.splice.admin.api.client.commands.HttpClientBuilder.$anonfun$getApiErrorFromResponse$5(HttpCommand.scala:114)
        at scala.util.Success.map(Try.scala:270)
        at scala.concurrent.Future.$anonfun$map$1(Future.scala:249)

Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thx.

elements.text:
We are having trouble deploying 0.4.3 on MainNet using docker-compose method. When we first deployed it, all containers were healthy but had issues with Auth0 and redirects. Made some changes to our .env file, destroyed the containers and volumes, and redeployed (like we did in DevNet) and now the validator container shows unhealthy -> "container splice-validator-validator-1 is unhealthy" and goes into "starting" loop:
ed8d549f967a
ghcr.io/digital-asset/decentralized-canton-sync/docker/validator-app:0.4.3

"/usr/bin/tini -- /a…"   18 minutes ago   Up 42 seconds (health: starting)   5003/tcp, 10013/tcp                   splice-validator-validator-1

From the container logs, I see the following errors:
Caused by: org.lfdecentralizedtrust.splice.admin.api.client.commands.HttpCommandException: HTTP 401 Unauthorized POST at '/api/sv/v0/onboard/validator' on
sv.sv-2.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com

. Command failed, message: Secret has already been used for a different validator.
        at org.lfdecentralizedtrust.splice.admin.api.client.commands.HttpClientBuilder.$anonfun$getApiErrorFromResponse$5(HttpCommand.scala:114)
        at scala.util.Success.map(Try.scala:270)
        at scala.concurrent.Future.$anonfun$map$1(Future.scala:249)

Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thx.

text: If this is the first time you've updated your stack since you initially deploying, you may have forgotten to remove the onboarding secret from your configuration. That value only needs to be populated for the initial launch.

elements.text: If this is the first time you've updated your stack since you initially deploying, you may have forgotten to remove the onboarding secret from your configuration. That value only needs to be populated for the initial launch.

text:
So I am restarting/redeploying validator using: ./start.sh -s "$SPONSOR_SV_URL" -o "" -p "$PARTY_HINT" -m "$MIGRATION_ID" -w -a

Not sure why now it is complaining about unknown secret. Any ideas?

elements.text:
So I am restarting/redeploying validator using: ./start.sh -s "$SPONSOR_SV_URL" -o "" -p "$PARTY_HINT" -m "$MIGRATION_ID" -w -a

Not sure why now it is complaining about unknown secret. Any ideas?

text: *Could you please point me to where I should start, where I can find the documentation, and what is expected from us at this stage?*

elements.text: Could you please point me to where I should start, where I can find the documentation, and what is expected from us at this stage?

text: Looks like the correct command. Could there be something going on with the persistence in your stack, either the docker volumes or your database, that was lost and caused the validator to think it still needs to onboard?

elements.text: Looks like the correct command. Could there be something going on with the persistence in your stack, either the docker volumes or your database, that was lost and caused the validator to think it still needs to onboard?

text: I did remove the volumes before de-deploying.

elements.text: I did remove the volumes before de-deploying.

text: I'm not sure if that would cause it, but that seems like the next most likely thing.

elements.text: I'm not sure if that would cause it, but that seems like the next most likely thing.

text: How do we resolve this? Should we request a new secret?

elements.text: How do we resolve this? Should we request a new secret?

text: I haven't been through this scenario before. I'm not sure if you can re-onboard a validator with a new secret, but you can check with your sponsor.

elements.text: I haven't been through this scenario before. I'm not sure if you can re-onboard a validator with a new secret, but you can check with your sponsor.

text: One more clarification — do we need to start with DevNet only, or should we set up all three networks: DevNet, TestNet, and MainNet?

elements.text: One more clarification — do we need to start with DevNet only, or should we set up all three networks: DevNet, TestNet, and MainNet?
